data.title: Katy Perry's telltale Russell Brand interview resurfaces after 10 years
data.meta_description: Katy Perry once hinted at knowing 'the real truth' about her ex-husband Russell Brand in a Vogue interview. Russell married Katy in 2010.
data.text:
Katy Perry once seemingly hinted at knowing ‘the real truth’ about her ex-husband Russell Brand in a resurfaced interview.

The comedian, 48, featured in Channel 4 and The Times’ collaborative Dispatches episode on Saturday night in which he faced allegations of rape, sexual assault, and controlling and emotionally abusive behaviour.

He denied the ‘very very serious allegations’ in a video posted across his social media platforms on Friday night ahead of the episode, as well as an expose from the newspaper.

Fireworks hitmaker Perry, 38, made remarks about Brand in an interview following their breakup.

The pair’s whirlwind romance began in 2009, before they married on October 23, 2010, in a lavish ceremony at a tiger sanctuary in India.

However, the pair split just 14 months later when Brand told Perry he wanted a divorce via text message before she was set to hit the stage.

‘At first, when I met him, he wanted an equal, and I think a lot of times strong men do want an equal, but then they get that equal and they’re like, “I can’t handle the equalness,”‘ she told Vogue in 2013.

She described his attitude towards her as ‘very controlling,’ especially when it came to her touring lifestyle before hinting at deeper issues with Brand and his behaviour.

‘I felt a lot of responsibility for it ending, but then I found out the real truth,’ she said. ‘I keep it locked in my safe for a rainy day.’

Similarly, Dannii Minogue labelled Brand a ‘vile predator’ in an interview from 17 years ago.

Speaking to The Mirror at the Michele Watches Summer Party, she said of Brand: ‘He is completely crazy and a bit of a vile predator.

‘I certainly don’t think he has cured his sex addiction, that’s for sure.’

‘He wouldn’t take no for an answer,’ she added. ‘He always goes that step too far.

‘Never quite far enough to slap his face, but usually too far.’

Minogue continued: ‘He’s obviously very intelligent – but he wears more make-up than I do.

‘Normally I love guys with eyeliner on. It can be very sexy, but not on Russell. Absolutely no way, never, he’s just not my type.’

Minogue later said Brand had leched over her ‘fabulous breasts’ and claimed he followed her down a corridor and offered his phone number to her.
